com.example.AutoSched.User

Class UserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.AutoSched.User.UserController

  • @RestController
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
    Logic for incoming and outgoing http requests for users

      • getAllData

        @GetMapping(value="/user/getAllData")
public java.util.List<User> getAllData()
        Gets all users name and id in a list of objects
        Returns:
        A list of all users

      • saveUser

        @PostMapping(value="/user/save")
public SessionId saveUser(@RequestBody
                                                           AccountCredentials a)
                                                    throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Given account credentials in the http body, this method creates a new User, hashes the password, and generates the user id and session id
        Parameters:
        a - Account credentials (Username and plaintext password
        Returns:
        The sessionId (user id and session id) when successful, throws error when not
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • delUser

        @DeleteMapping(value="/user/del/{userId}")
public java.lang.String delUser(@PathVariable
                                                                           int userId,
                                                                           @RequestBody
                                                                           SessionId s)
        Attempts to delete user from given user id
        Parameters:
        userId - Id of user to be deleted
        s - Session id to authenticate user making this request. Must be user being deleted or admin
        Returns:
        Success message when successful else throws an error

      • addFriend

        @PutMapping(value="/user/addFriend/{userId}")
public java.lang.String addFriend(@PathVariable
                                                                                int userId,
                                                                                @RequestBody
                                                                                SessionId s)
        Attempts to add friend to user that is authenticated with session id. If the friend has not sent a friend request a friend request will be sent. If a friend request has been sent by friend user both users will have each other added to their friends list and the request will be removed
        Parameters:
        userId - Id of the attended friend
        s - Session id of the requester
        Returns:
        Returns success message if successful. Else it will throw an error

      • delFriend

                                                                            SessionId s)

        Parameters:

        s - Session id of the requester
        Returns:
        Returns success message if successful. Else it will throw an error

      • addUserToGroup

        @PutMapping(value="/user/{userId}/addGroup/{groupId}")
java.lang.String addUserToGroup(@PathVariable
                                                                                       int userId,
                                                                                       @PathVariable
                                                                                       int groupId,
                                                                                       @RequestBody
                                                                                       SessionId s)
        Attempts to add user to group. This method it for instructors and admins and must authenticate as one or the other to perform this operation
        Parameters:
        userId - Id of user to be added to group
        groupId - Id of group
        s - Session id of user making the request
        Returns:
        Returns success message if successful. Else it will throw an error

                                                                                          throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • login

        @PostMapping(value="user/login")
public SessionId login(@RequestBody
                                                        AccountCredentials a)
                                                 throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Attempts to login (create session id) to user with provided user credentials
        Parameters:
        a - Account credentials (username and password)
        Returns:
        Returns session id if successful. Else it will throw an error
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

        Parameters:
